1.text: And do thou speak what becomes sound doctrine:

2.text: The aged men to be sober, grave, of sound mind, sound in the faith, in love, in patience.

3.text: The aged women likewise, becoming holy in a serene state of mind, not accusers, not slaves to much wine, teachers of good;

4.text: That they render the young women discreet, to be lovers of the husband, lovers of the children,

5.text: Of sound mind chaste, remaining at home, good subordinates to their own husbands, that the word of God be not defamed.

6.text: The younger men likewise beseech to be of sound mind.

7.text: Concerning all things hold thyself a type of good works: in doctrine, integrity, gravity, incorruptibility,

8.text: The word sound, not to be condemned; that he from the opposite may be changed, having nothing bad to say of you.

9.text: Servants to be subordinate to their own masters, to be pleasing in all things; not contradicting;

10.text: Not purloining, but showing all good faith; that they may adorn the doctrine of the Saviour our God in all things.

11.text: For the grace of God who saves, was manifested to all men,

12.text: Teaching us that, denying ungodliness and eager worldly desires, we should live discreetly, and justly, and religiously, in the time now;

13.text: Expecting the blessed hope, and appearance of the glory of the great God and our Saviour Jesus Christ;

14.text: Who gave himself for us, that he might redeem us from all iniquity, and purify to himself a distinguished people, zealous of good works.

15.text: These things speak, and beseech, and reprove with all order. Let none despise thee.
